DOC.HEADLINE: NATION IN BRIEF ; NATIONWIDE ; ANTIBODY IS USED TO FIGHT PNEUMONIA
DOC.TEXT: Researchers from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious_Diseases and the Scripps Research Institute said they have successfully used human antibody fragments in mice to fight a common pneumonia virus.The study was published in the latest Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences . Pieces of human antibody were used to treat mice for respiratory syncytial virus , the major worldwide cause of pneumonia in infants and children . Single doses applied by nasal spray over three days completely cured the infection , the researchers said . It may be eventually possible to develop antibody treatments for other viral infections , including influenza and the common_cold , researchers said .
